inventory.name: Chain Mail
inventory.description: Made of interlocking metal rings, chain mail includes a layer of quilted fabric worn underneath the mail to prevent chafing and to cushion the impact of blows.

inventory.name: Longsword
inventory.description: A versatile weapon that can be used with one or two hands.

inventory.name: Shield
inventory.description: A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand.

mythic_events.name: The Stone Pact
mythic_events.description: Rival tribes sealed a covenant at the Stone Circle and formed lasting alliances.

artifact_lore.name: Ring of the Stone Pact
artifact_lore.creation_story: Forged from the melted weapons of twelve warring tribes who swore peace at the Stone Circle. Each band of the ring bears one tribe's sigil, eternally intertwined.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: Symbol of diplomacy, alliance, and the power of keeping one's word. Many treaties are still sworn upon this ring's memory.
legendary_properties: Wearer can cast Zone of Truth once per day
Advantage on Persuasion checks when negotiating peace or treaties
Can understand all spoken languages
When making a promise while wearing the ring, both parties know if the promise is sincere
artifact_lore.location_hint: Kept in the vault of a neutral sanctuary where the original pact was signed

mythic_events.name: Sundered Gate
mythic_events.description: A fortress gate was broken in a famous siege, changing military doctrine.

artifact_lore.name: Shield of the Sundered Gate
artifact_lore.creation_story: Salvaged from the legendary gate that held back armies for three months. When the gate finally fell, this shield was recovered from the breach, still bearing the marks of a thousand weapons.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: Represents unwavering defense and the ultimate sacrifice. Military academies teach tactics based on the Sundered Gate defense.
legendary_properties: +3 magical shield
Grants +3 to AC instead of +2
Once per short rest, can use reaction to become immovable until next turn
Bearer has advantage on saving throws against being moved or knocked prone
artifact_lore.location_hint: Mounted on display in the ruins of the fortress where the gate once stood

mythic_events.name: The Quiet Plague
mythic_events.description: A sickness passed through generations and reshaped population centers.

artifact_lore.name: Chalice of the Quiet Plague
artifact_lore.creation_story: Fashioned by healers during the Quiet Plague in a desperate attempt to understand the sickness. Those who drank from it could sense disease, though many died in the attempt.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: A grim reminder of past suffering, but also of the courage of healers. Medical traditions still reference the sacrifices made during the plague.
legendary_properties: Wearer can cast Detect Poison and Disease at will
Advantage on Medicine checks
Once per day, can remove one disease from a touched creature
Immune to disease (but can still carry and transmit)
artifact_lore.location_hint: Sealed in a quarantine vault in the ruins of a plague hospital

mythic_events.name: Sundered Gate
mythic_events.description: A fortress gate was broken in a famous siege, changing military doctrine.

artifact_lore.name: Shield of the Sundered Gate
artifact_lore.creation_story: Salvaged from the legendary gate that held back armies for three months. When the gate finally fell, this shield was recovered from the breach, still bearing the marks of a thousand weapons.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: Represents unwavering defense and the ultimate sacrifice. Military academies teach tactics based on the Sundered Gate defense.
legendary_properties: +3 magical shield
Grants +3 to AC instead of +2
Once per short rest, can use reaction to become immovable until next turn
Bearer has advantage on saving throws against being moved or knocked prone
artifact_lore.location_hint: Mounted on display in the ruins of the fortress where the gate once stood

mythic_events.name: The Hidden Spring
mythic_events.description: A spring with strange properties was found and became sacred.

artifact_lore.name: Amulet of the Hidden Spring
artifact_lore.creation_story: Carved from crystal found at the bottom of a mystical spring with waters that never run dry. The amulet contains a single drop of the spring's water, eternally preserved.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: Sacred relic representing healing, renewal, and the mysteries of nature. Pilgrims still seek the Hidden Spring's location.
legendary_properties: Wearer regains 1 hit point at the start of each turn if below half HP
Once per day, can cast Lesser Restoration
Advantage on Constitution saving throws against poison and disease
Never suffers thirst-related damage or exhaustion
artifact_lore.location_hint: Lost when the shrine to the Hidden Spring was flooded in the Great Deluge

mythic_events.name: The Lost City
mythic_events.description: An entire city vanished under unknown circumstances, leaving myths and ruins.

artifact_lore.name: Horn of the Lost City
artifact_lore.creation_story: The only remaining artifact from a city that vanished in a single night. When blown, some claim to hear echoes of the lost city's final moments.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: A haunting reminder of hubris and the fragility of civilization. Scholars study it seeking clues to the city's fate.
legendary_properties: When blown, creates a thunderous sound audible for miles
Once per day, can cast Sending to contact someone in the lost city (may reach the dead)
Reveals illusions and hidden passages within 60 feet when sounded
Bearer has advantage on History checks about lost civilizations
artifact_lore.location_hint: Found in the ruins where the lost city once stood, guarded by restless spirits

mythic_events.name: The Broken Crown
mythic_events.description: A king betrayed his oath and plunged the realm into civil war.

artifact_lore.name: The Ancestors' Blade
artifact_lore.creation_story: Forged in the heart of a dying star by the First Smiths, this blade was tempered in the tears of ancient kings. It was wielded by seven generations of heroes before being lost in the fall of the Last Kingdom.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: Symbol of rightful leadership and martial prowess. Many noble houses claim descent from its original bearers.
legendary_properties: +3 magical weapon
Deals an extra 2d6 radiant damage to creatures of darkness
Bearer has advantage on Charisma checks when dealing with nobles
Once per day, can rally allies within 30 feet (advantage on saving throws for 1 minute)
artifact_lore.location_hint: Lost in the ruins of a fallen fortress during the Broken Crown civil war

mythic_events.name: Sundered Gate
mythic_events.description: A fortress gate was broken in a famous siege, changing military doctrine.

artifact_lore.name: Shield of the Sundered Gate
artifact_lore.creation_story: Salvaged from the legendary gate that held back armies for three months. When the gate finally fell, this shield was recovered from the breach, still bearing the marks of a thousand weapons.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: Represents unwavering defense and the ultimate sacrifice. Military academies teach tactics based on the Sundered Gate defense.

Once per short rest, can use reaction to become immovable until next turn
Bearer has advantage on saving throws against being moved or knocked prone
artifact_lore.location_hint: Mounted on display in the ruins of the fortress where the gate once stood

mythic_events.name: Forging of the Ancestors' Blade
mythic_events.description: A legendary blade was forged, later lost and sought by many.

artifact_lore.name: The Ancestors' Blade
artifact_lore.creation_story: Forged in the heart of a dying star by the First Smiths, this blade was tempered in the tears of ancient kings. It was wielded by seven generations of heroes before being lost in the fall of the Last Kingdom.
artifact_lore.cultural_significance: Symbol of rightful leadership and martial prowess. Many noble houses claim descent from its original bearers.

civilizations.name: Brilliant Tinkertown
civilizations.religious_beliefs: Follow the Path of Endless Discovery
civilizations.cultural_description: Brilliant Tinkertown is a gnome civilization governed by democratic vote. Their culture is defined by mastery of arcane arts, pursuit of knowledge and wisdom.

territory.territorial_description: Brilliant Tinkertown controls a modest territory of 7 regions centered on their capital in the Temperate Forest.

civilizations.name: The Deep Halls of Hammerhome
civilizations.cultural_description: The Deep Halls of Hammerhome is a dwarf civilization united confederation of clans. Their culture is defined by reverence for ancient traditions, legendary craftsmanship.

territory.territorial_description: The Deep Halls of Hammerhome controls a compact territory of 3 regions centered on their capital in the Temperate Forest.

notable_features: Vast underground cities carved from living rock

civilizations.name: Azure Kingdom of Avalon
civilizations.religious_beliefs: Practice diverse faiths with religious tolerance
civilizations.cultural_description: Azure Kingdom of Avalon is a human civilization governed by democratic vote. Their culture is defined by spirit of innovation and progress, strict laws and social order, pursuit of glory and renown.

territory.territorial_description: Azure Kingdom of Avalon controls a expansive territory of 16 regions centered on their capital in the Temperate Forest.

notable_features: Renowned universities and centers of learning
Strong merchant guilds and trade traditions

civilizations.name: Starfall Court
civilizations.cultural_description: Starfall Court is a elf civilization ruled by hereditary monarchs. Their culture is defined by pursuit of knowledge and wisdom, reverence for ancient traditions, mastery of arcane arts.

territory.territorial_description: Starfall Court controls a substantial territory of 9 regions centered on their capital in the Temperate Forest.

civilizations.name: Gateway Cosmopolis
civilizations.cultural_description: Gateway Cosmopolis is a cosmopolitan, multi-racial civilization governed by elected councils. Their culture is defined by prosperous trade and accumulation of wealth, strict laws and social order.

territory.territorial_description: Gateway Cosmopolis controls a expansive territory of 14 regions centered on their capital in the Temperate Forest.

notable_features: Universities attracting scholars from all races

civilizations.name: Multicultural Federation
civilizations.cultural_description: Multicultural Federation is a cosmopolitan, multi-racial civilization ruled by hereditary monarchs. Their culture is defined by prosperous trade and accumulation of wealth, strict laws and social order, fierce independence and personal liberty.

territory.territorial_description: Multicultural Federation controls a modest territory of 4 regions centered on their capital in the Temperate Forest.

notable_features: Melting pot of cultures and traditions

civilizations.name: Whimsical Tinkertown
civilizations.religious_beliefs: Follow the Path of Endless Discovery
civilizations.cultural_description: Whimsical Tinkertown is a gnome civilization governed by elected councils. Their culture is defined by legendary craftsmanship, spirit of innovation and progress.

territory.territorial_description: Whimsical Tinkertown controls a expansive territory of 13 regions centered on their capital in the Temperate Forest.
